app_metadata.description: ViTransfer - Professional video review and approval platform for filmmakers
app_metadata.name: vitransfer

run_as_context.description: ViTransfer runs as any non-root user.
Redis runs as any non-root user.

app_metadata.title: ViTransfer

groups.name: User and Group Configuration
groups.description: Configure User and Group for ViTransfer

attrs.label: Postgres Image (CAUTION)
attrs.description:
If you are changing this after the postgres directory has been initialized,</br>
STOP! and make sure you have a backup of your data.</br>
Changing this will trigger an one way database upgrade.</br>
You can only select newer versions of postgres.</br>
Selecting an older version will refuse to start.</br>
If something goes wrong, you will have to restore from backup.

attrs.label: Database Password
attrs.description:
PostgreSQL database password (hex/URL-safe only).</br>
Generate with: openssl rand -hex 32</br>
IMPORTANT: Use hex format (no special characters like +/=)

attrs.label: Redis Password
attrs.description:
Redis password for queue and cache (hex/URL-safe only).</br>
Generate with: openssl rand -hex 32</br>
IMPORTANT: Use hex format (no special characters like +/=)

attrs.label: JWT Secret
attrs.description:
Secret for signing JWT access tokens (base64).</br>
Generate with: openssl rand -base64 64</br>
Used for admin authentication sessions

attrs.label: JWT Refresh Secret
attrs.description:
Secret for signing JWT refresh tokens (base64).</br>
Generate with: openssl rand -base64 64</br>
Used for token rotation and renewal

attrs.label: Encryption Key
attrs.description:
AES-256 encryption key for sensitive data (base64).</br>
Generate with: openssl rand -base64 32</br>
Used for encrypting passwords and credentials

attrs.label: Share Token Secret
attrs.description:
Secret for signing share link tokens (base64).</br>
Generate with: openssl rand -base64 64</br>
REQUIRED for v0.6.0+ - Used for client share authentication

attrs.label: Initial Admin Name
attrs.description:
Display name for the initial admin user.</br>
Only used during first-time setup

attrs.label: Admin Email
attrs.description:
Initial admin email address for first-time setup.</br>
Used only during initial setup when no admin exists.</br>
Must be a valid email address

attrs.label: Admin Password
attrs.description:
Initial admin password for first-time setup.</br>
Must be at least 8 characters long.</br>
Avoid special characters (!, @, #) due to JSON parsing.</br>
Change this password after first login!

attrs.label: Application URL
attrs.description:
The URI for ViTransfer</br>
For example: http://example.com

attrs.label: HTTPS Security (HSTS)
attrs.description:
Enable HSTS (HTTP Strict Transport Security) header.</br>
NOTE: This does NOT change the server port. The app always listens on HTTP.</br>
This setting only controls HSTS header for reverse proxy deployments.</br>
</br>
v0.6.0+ uses bearer tokens (no cookies) - this only affects HSTS.</br>
</br>
When enabled (true - recommended for production):</br>
- HSTS header enabled (forces browser to use HTTPS)</br>
- Use behind reverse proxy (Nginx, Traefik, Caddy) with HTTPS</br>
</br>
When disabled (false - for local/development):</br>
- No HSTS enforcement</br>
- Use for localhost or LAN-only deployments without reverse proxy</br>
</br>
Default: false (for localhost/LAN compatibility)

attrs.label: User ID
attrs.description: The user id that ViTransfer files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Group ID
attrs.description: The group id that ViTransfer files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Port Bind Mode
attrs.description:
The port bind mode.</br>
- Publish: The port will be published on the host for external access.</br>
- Expose: The port will be exposed for inter-container communication.</br>
- None: The port will not be exposed or published.</br>
Note: If the Dockerfile defines an EXPOSE directive,
the port will still be exposed for inter-container communication regardless of this setting.

enum.description: Publish port on the host for external access

attrs.label: Host IPs
attrs.description: IPs on the host to bind this port

attrs.label: Redis Data Storage
attrs.description: Persistent storage for Redis queue and cache data.

ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.

ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

attrs.label: Automatic Permissions
attrs.description:
Automatically set permissions for the host path.
Enabling this, will check the top level directory,</br>
If it finds incorrect permissions, it will `chown` the
host path to the user and group required for the
postgres container.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.</br>
SMB Share: Is a SMB share that is mounted to as a volume.</br>
NFS Share: Is a NFS share that is mounted to as a volume.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)
SMB/CIFS Share (Mounts a volume to a SMB share)
NFS Share (Mounts a volume to a NFS share)

attrs.description: Mount the volume as read only.
